    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void autoSortDates​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles sorting the table automatically if a new date is picked - otherwise the user would have to re-select the radio button they want to get the table to re-sort.
      void byContactReport​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the button event to take the user to the report which shows appointments based on selected customer.
      void byCountryReport​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the button event to take the user to the report showing appointments based on Country and Type.
      void checkForUpcomingAppointment()
      Checks whether this is an appointment within 15 minutes of the user logging in, and displays an alert with the information if there is, or an alert saying there is no appointments if there isn't.
      void handleLogOut​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Allows the user to log out, and resets the current user, then takes the user back to the main login screen.
      void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      Interface specific method which runs at scene initialization.
      void manageApptBtn​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles button event to change to the appointments management screen.
      void manageCustBtn​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles button event to change to the customer management screen.
      void setApptTable()
      Sets the main appointments table on the main screen, which allows the user to view all of the appointments.
      void setTableToMonth​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Sets the appointments displayed to shoow only those for the month which matches that of the date selected in the date picker.
      void setTableToWeek​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Filters the displayed appointments to those that are occurring during the same week as selected in the datepicker.
      void typeMonthReport​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Button event handler to take the user to the report showing Appointments based on type and month.

      • checkForUpcomingAppointment

        public void checkForUpcomingAppointment()
        Checks whether this is an appointment within 15 minutes of the user logging in, and displays an alert with the information if there is, or an alert saying there is no appointments if there isn't. Lambda expression is used here to iterate through each of the appointments in a cleaner way that an for loop

      • initialize

      • setTableToWeek

        public void setTableToWeek​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Filters the displayed appointments to those that are occurring during the same week as selected in the datepicker. Week is displayed Sun-Sat, so if a Wed. is selected, it will show the 3 days prior, the day selected, and the 3 days after.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -

      • setTableToMonth

        public void setTableToMonth​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Sets the appointments displayed to shoow only those for the month which matches that of the date selected in the date picker.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
